review_blob: 12 oz bottle. Very grapefruit in color. Carbonation was that of a soda. This wasnt a sweet as other radlers which is a good thing. You can really taste the grapefruit and this would be great on a hot day.
Bottle at rbwg. Lots of ginger in the most. Nice tart breer with great ginger flavor.

beer_brewer_name: Pivovarna Ledenika (Ledenika i MM AD - Bulbrew)
review_blob: From plastic bottle at rbwg. Very sweet in smell and taste. Perfect European lager

beer_brewer_name: Melvin Brewing Company (Thai Me Up Restaurant & Brewery)
review_blob: On tap at bier thirty. Very copper in color, thin head. Piney hop flavor. Nice and crisp
On tap at rbwg. Wow this was great. Looked like motor oil. Tasted like thick coffee and chocolaty amazingness.
16 oz can. Thick head and nice citra hip nose. Very clean and crisp on the tongue. Definitely enjoyed this one even though the only reason I traded for it was the name.
Bottle shared from rich. Has a beautiful Purple hue to it. Thin head and medium carbonation. Funky blueberry smelly. This beer taste amazing. Has the right amount of tartness with the blueberry.
beer_name: Reaver Beach Within The Flood Marks

review_blob: From can. Wow this brings me back to Germany. Hazy color banana nose. Has sweet wheat flavor. This is how a hefe was meant to taste.
Bottle thank to jgalt. Cranberry nose. Taste was amazing. Didnt taste fake like most of the ciders coming out. Cranberry was well balanced with the apple flavor
From a can. Golden in colour, taste like a true pilz. Malty lager nose with slight hoppyness in flavor.
From the bottle. Pours dark purple with thin head. Black cap is very prevalent in the nose and taste. Not overly tart, and everything blends very well.
On tap at Woodland empire. Almost has a carrot hue to it. Nice sweet carrot nose. Taste is tart, carrot with a little sweetness. This is a weird combo to see bur damn it works out well.
beer_name: Woodland Empire Set Em Wild, Set Em Free - Carrot

review_blob: On tap at bier thirty. Pours dark with thin tan head. Sweet bourbon flavor in the nose. Great coffee chocolate bourbon flavor. Everything blends very well.
beer_name: Fremont Dark Star - Bourbon Barrel Coffee Edition

review_blob: 22 oz bottle thanks to stevoj. Lots of spice in the nose. Smooth chocolate flavor, with light carbonation.
From bottle. Light tartness good raspberry flavor with chocolate notes in background. Great beer

12 oz bottle. This is a classic type gose not the new American type. I wasnt a fan of the smokeyness on the first sip, but after my taste buds recalibrated it actually blended well. Tartness comes in more predominant with the smoke on the back end.
On tap at the brewery. Dark brown in color. Nose has a sour prune smell. As this beer warms up the whiskey comes out more. Slightly tart with dark fruit notes.
On tap at the brewery. Copper in color, thin head. The sourness in this comes out great, not over powering with slight bitter hoppyness.

beer_brewer_name: Melvin Brewing Company (Thai Me Up Restaurant & Brewery)
review_blob: On tap at bier 30. Wow this is a great double ipa. Great hop nose, not overly overly sweet and bitterness. Alcohol is very well hidden.
On tap at the brewery. Very clean looking in appearance. Crisp and clean, pretty standard pilsner.
Bottle at rbwg apricot could be more prevalent and it would be better. Nothing really stands out
beer_name: Casey Fruit Stand Farmhouse Ale - Apricot

review_blob: On tap at rbwg. Finally a dark lord I like. Heavy vanilla in nose. Thick marshmallow and stout taste. This coats your mouth heavy lingers for awhile.
beer_name: Three Floyds Dark Lord Russian Imperial Stout (Bourbon Vanilla Bean)

review_blob: May the force be with you. Finally cracked this and damn its smooth and sweet. The dark side will find you with this one
Pours nice and smooth. Very thick mouth feel. Barrel come out and really balances this beer
Sample from bottle. Peach nose, light tartness and peach flavor. I could drink this all day
This was great, but could use a little drying out, since its overly sweet. It looks like the ghost busters slimer drink from childhood. Green tea is prevalent and taste like it
beer_name: Shinsei Matcha no Osake Green Tea Sake

review_blob: 10 oz pour on tap at the brewery. Good hoppyness but dont really taste any of the wine.
Great name. Smooth beer. Even if you dont want it youll get it. Dark and smooth it will treat you the way it should
On tap at the brewery. Dont know how they did this but damn this is good. Coconut and hops blend well.
On tap at city beer. This beer delivers its name. Pours murky orange. Apricot is very present and not overly sour.
8 oz pour. Im not writing a review, because Im worried about getting a long email back.
No hops in the nose at all. Taste bland and nothing really going on. This recipe should be tossed in the garbage
On tap at the brewery. This was not good at all. Diacetyl as all hell. Could barely finish. Idk what theyre doing but its not making beer.
16 oz can. Thought I had added this one. Poured a nice amber color with nice piney hops scent to it. Very good balance with the malt and hops. Definitely enjoyed this one.
12 oz can. Slight hops in the nose. Taste bitter with slight maltyness. Could use more hop profile in my opinion.
22 oz bottle. Nice smooth flavor. Wine barrel doesnt overpower butility adds a little complexity to the beer.
beer_name: Straight To Ale Laika Russian Imperial Stout - Cabernet Barrel Aged

review_blob: 12 oz bottle. Nice funky smell. Taste nothing like the base beer, but not a bad thing. Low carbonation has a nice tart sour brown taste and almost a hint of cherries.
beer_name: Woodland Empire Crispy Apple Turnover - Brett Clausenii

review_blob: On tap at the brewery. Good coconut nose to it. Very smooth on the palate, coconut works well with this beer.
Bottle from trade. I thought I loved atrial but then I tried this. Sherry adds a little more complexity and you can still taste the base beer. So glad I got this
beer_name: Jester King Sherry Barrel Atrial Rubicite

review_blob: 12 oz bottle. Standard Pale ale. Not much going on to make it stand out among others in the class. Does well on a hot day.
12 oz bottle. I did not enjoy this beer at all. A lot of off flavors that did not mix well.
If I liked barley wines I might rate this higher. Barrel aging probably helps take some of the bite out which I like.
Amazing imperial stout. Smooth chocolate and bourbon flavor, not overpowering like a lot of BA beers. Always glad to drink this.
beer_name: Big Sky Ivan the Terrible Imperial Stout - Bourbon Barrel

review_blob: Had this beer a few times. Very good double IPA. Great nose and taste, if it were easier to get I would trade for more often but definitely over hyped.
Probably one of the best IPAs I can find year round. Everything in this beer is well balanced. I do not know why this beer is not more sought after, but I am glad I can get it.
I did not have high hope for this beer, but it proved me wrong. Nice wild nose to it. Taste was amazing tart and peaches. Very well done.
12 oz can. Was not a big fan of this, it was a little malty for my taste but not a bad beer. Would not seek out again
12 oz can. Im not really a fan of East coast ipas but this won was good. Malt and hops were very well balanced and alcohol was hidden well.
beer_name: DC Brau On the Wings of Armageddon

review_blob: Bottle from 1st release. Hops and tartness were very well balanced, I could drink this all day long. Hope to try again.
Ive had this numerous times from a bottle. Great adjunct beer taste and smells like creme brulee. Would go great with ice cream.
beer_name: Southern Tier Blackwater Series: Creme Brulee Stout
